course.subject: LIFS
course.name: A Practicum on Wetland Conservation
course.description: This course engages students in practical training and enriches their knowledge in biodiversity and skills in interpretive services under ecotourism. The students will also have a chance to contribute to the society through environmental education. At the end of the course, students should gain hands-on experience in environmental conservation and improve their skills in communication, problem solving, team work, and time management. For LIFS, ENVS and OST students only. Approval of the course coordinator is needed for students to enroll in this course. Graded PP, P or F.

reviews.author: Daniel's
reviews.title: Great course if Ice KO is not involved
reviews.comment_content:
You should have the syllabus attached to the invitation email.

So I would use this area to talk about the interview.
Group interview of around 6 people.

1. Prep. a 2 minutes talk in cantonese about:
- Hong Kong Wetland Park OR
- Wetland Ecology OR
- Wetland Biodiversity

2. Questions asked by Ice Ko in cantonese
*couldn't rember the exact wordings"
e.g.
如果呢個course嘅workshop你其他活動撞時間你會點做？
你係點做 time management？


Remember to be Punctual and expect delay from the previsous session.

In my case Ice Ko spent total an hour interviewing, though we only spoke for no longer than 2 minues per student.

The remaining time were for Ice Ko to promote the LIFS peer mentoring program and the LIFS Professional Development Workshop. and emphasised on time management + being professional (though I dunno how using 45 minues to talk about another program during an interview is considered as a professional interviewer)

BTW no information about the Wetland Practicum course will be obtained through the interview. at least in my case.
reviews.comment_teaching:
# Training in Wetland Park
very useful and practical

Morning: Lectures in the morning learning the different species of plant/ animal in the park + how to recognize them

Afternoon: Observing how actual volunteers in HK wetland park give tours. All the volunteers and staff are very professional and knowledgeable.

# Meetings with Ice Ko
A waste of time repeating what is good about the LIFS peer mentoring and LIFS professional development workshop again and again even in front of the staff of wetland park when we are already late.

Any questions about LIFS2011 will be answered as I don't know yet.

# video editing/ shooting
Taught by Mr. Shek
a very knowledgeable, helpful, and nice teacher
We use Adobe Premiere Pro (LIFS department gave us money to buy it this year)

Originally he will also teach us how to do video shooting in the park
reviews.comment_grading:
Pass or Fail
If you are normal you could pass the course.
reviews.comment_workload:
Due to COVID 19, no practical things could be done. So instead, we had 2 video editing projects

# 3 Days workshop in the Wetland Park (10:00--17:00)
Could be very demanding, cause there are a lot of things to recite if we needed to do On-site services.

# 2 Training in video editing/shooting with Mr. Shek (a formerly staff in MTPC)

# Assignment 1: 6-minute video

#Assignment 2: 2-minute video

# Exhuasing Group meetings with Ice KO
